headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE ASIA. Intelligence from the Seat of War. Details of the Late Russian Victories. Fresh Propositions of the Czar. THE POSITION OF THE GERMAN POWERS. Reopening of Negotiations through Austria. INCREASE OF THE FRENCH ARMY. Splendid Banquet to Lord Elgin. Speeches of Lord John Russell and Mr. Buchanan DEBATES IN PARLIAMENT. IMPORTANT REFORM IN TURKEY. Commercial and Financial News. Flour and Grain Dull--Rise in Cotton and the Funds.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British Mail steamer Asia arrived at this port yesterday morning at 12 o'clock having sailed from Liverpool on Saturday the 8th. The Arabia reached Liverpool at 8 1/2 that morning. The Washington arrived on Friday. The steamship Ottawa, from Portland, arrived also on Friday, taking advices later than had been received.

THE EASTERN WAR.; Interesting Developments Concerning the Policy of the German Powers.

byline.original: POLITICAL CORRESPONDENCE OF NEW-YORK DAILY TIMES

headline.main: TRIAL OF JOHN M. FENETY FOR ARSON.; THE HAYS CASE POSTPONED. APPLICATION FOR BAIL REFUSED.

docs.lead_paragraph: COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER--Monday. Before Judge Roosevelt. The Court met on Monday morning at 10 1/2 o'clock. The District Attorney stated that he should not be able to take up the case of William and Clara Hays, in consequence of the illness of Mrs. Lutener, wife of the deceased, and Mr. Shallow, who was just recovering from the typhoid fever.

headline.main: FRANCE.; POLITICAL AND PERSONAL MOVEMENTS. Literary, Theatrical and Miscellaneous Items.

docs.lead_paragraph: The requirement of the Post-Office, that letters for the Southampton steamers leaving on Wednesday, be mailed here on Sunday, renders it useless for a correspondent to attempt to give any summary of the political news, as the London journals taken out by the samesteamer extend two days later. headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New=York Daily Times. FROM WASHINGTON. Rejection of the Gadsden Treaty. CONGRESSIONAL PROCEEDINGS. SPIRITUAL MANIFESTATIONS IN THE SENATE. General Walbridge's Declaration of American Rights and Intentions.Intentions. THE CLERKS' SALARY BILL.

docs.lead_paragraph: The resolutions presented by General WALBRIDGE in the House, to-day, will be popular with the masses. He intends making a speech in due time. Mr. WALBRIDGE will doubtless be patriotic. The GADSDEN Treaty was defeated to-day, but it may be resuscitated. The vote for ratification was 27 against 18. The SLOO amendment was

byline.original: SPECIAL DISPATCH TO THE NEW-YORK DAILY TIMES

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; THE STORM--ACCIDENTS. EASTER DAY. COUNTERFEIT MEXICAN COIN. MORTALITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE STORM--ACCIDENTS.--In one instance, yesterday morning, an awning in front of LOSSEE'S Hotel, on Hamilton-avenue, fell, from the great weight of snow, while several persons were passing under it three of whom were seriously injured and a fourth slightly. A man named MICHAEL MCMULLEN, of Columbia-street, was one of the sufferers.
